intro: Columnea bilabiata, commonly known as the twin-lip columnea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that come in shades of red, orange, and yellow. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture, while its flowers bloom in clusters along the stems. Columnea bilabiata is appreciated for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in greenhouses or as a houseplant.
